question: A boat takes half time in moving a certain distance downstream than upstream. The ratio of the speed of the boat in still water and that of the current is :
explanation:
Let the speed of boat in still water = x km/hr, 
and Speed of current = y km/hr
Rate downstream = (x + y) km/hr, and Rate upstream = (x - y) km/hr
Distance = Speed $latex \\times$ Time
$latex \\therefore \\left ( x-y \\right )\\times 2t = \\left ( x+y \\right )\\times t$
$latex => 2x-2y = x+y$
$latex => 2x-x = 2y+y$
$latex => x = 3y$
$latex => \\frac{x}{y} = \\frac{3}{1} = 3 : 1&s=1$
Hence option [A] is correct answer.
